Before the game, starting pitcher and batter line-up can be selected from the team roster.

Gameplay itself follows the standard model of the time: players control pitching, batting, running and fielding, with pitching/batting seen from a view behind the batter and running/fielding seen from an overhead view of the field. The game supports various pitching styles, bunts, holding runners on, lead offs and steals.

The game also allows for players to create their own teams from all available players. Two team slots are available. Teams and season progress are saved to battery-backed RAM.
title: The Majors: Pro Baseball

description:
World Series Baseball is a baseball game for one or two players. It is the first entry in Sega's franchise of the same name and the first baseball game of its generation with a full MLB license. Teams and players are based on the 1993 season: all 28 teams including the expansion teams Colorado and Florida, as well as the two All-Star teams are included.

Gameplay and options are similar to the previous year's The Majors: Pro Baseball. Exhibition games, two-player matchups via Gear-to-Gear cable, and a full season (of either 32, 84, 123 or 162 games) including playoffs and World Series championship are available. Also returning is the option to edit one's own team, with two team slots for saving to battery-backed RAM. Three different stadiums (open, turf and dome) can be selected and pitcher and batter order be freely set.

Gameplay follows the standard model: players control all aspects of play, from a view behind the batter for batting and pitching and an overhead view of the field for running and fielding. On offense, players can lead off and steal bases, while defense allows for dives and jumps as well as unassisted plays.
title: World Series Baseball

description: Kaitō Saint Tail is a 2D top-down arcade game with several puzzle-solving minigames. The game is based on manga/anime series with this same name. The player controls the main heroine from the series, Meimi Haneoka (who is a schoolgirl and a magic thief). She runs in a maze, avoids police, and collects cards (cards are required to use magic). She meets various characters from series and talks with them. She can play in several minigames - Columns clone, various puzzles, and simple flight on balloons.
title: Kaitō Saint Tail

description:
The Game Gear received its own version of the two-in-one sports game licensed by the sports magazine, also available on other platforms.

The football module offers Exhibition and Season games (seasons can be saved via passwords), choice of difficulty (high school/college/pro) and selectable quarter length (5, 10 or 15 minutes). While there is no NFL license, the included teams are based on the 1995 season and include the two expansion teams Carolina and Jacksonville for a total of 30 teams. Gameplay is seen from a horizontally-scrolling view from above the field. The playbook allows choosing from over 90 plays.

The baseball module also includes Exhibition and Season games with a password function. It allows the setting of game length from one to nine innings and the toggling of automatic running. 28 MLB-based teams are available (but without an official license). Gameplay follows the standard model of the time: pitching and batting are seen from a view behind the batter. When a ball is hit, the view zooms out to show the entire field for running and catching.
title: Sports Illustrated: Championship Football & Baseball

description: In Sōkoban, players control a warehouse worker whose job is to push crates on to predetermined locations. Each stage is set up as a puzzle, where the player has to figure out how to maneuver these crates into these positions without blocking themselves, as the crates can only be pushed and not pulled. The game tracks how many steps the player takes as they solve a puzzle, with the ideal solution being the one found that takes as few steps as possible. The game contains 300 different puzzle stages to figure out.

sample_screenshots.caption: After each stage, you get a new password
Another puzzle carried over from other versions

title: Sōkoban

description:
Alien Syndrome for Game Gear is a sequel to the arcade game of the same name. Five years after the events of the original, alien hunters Ricky and Mary are called back into action when a distress call from the space transport Dagal is received. More alien creatures have invaded. They need to be destroyed and the crew rescued.

Gameplay is very similar to the original game: players select either Ricky or Mary (the difference is only visual) and must clear the levels (seen from an overhead perspective) by rescuing all crew members within a time limit while fighting off aliens. A map can be called up at any time to check where the crew members are. Panels in the walls reveal weapon power-ups, including lasers and flame throwers. Rescuing the last crew member opens up the exit. Upon leaving, a boss fight follows.

The game includes five different levels, four of which represent decks of the invaded ship. All are completely new designs not seen in the original game. Certain enemies are reused from the arcade, however, including most bosses. The final level consists solely of a boss fight against a new alien.
title: Alien Syndrome

description:
Tom and Jerry: The Movie is a tie-in to the 1992 animated film of the same name starring the famous cat & mouse duo. It is similar to the Master System version in gameplay, but has its own story (which is unrelated to the film) and entirely new level designs.

Tom has found a treasure map while playing in the attic. With Tom dreaming about how to spend the treasure, Jerry grabs the map and runs away. Now Tom has to chase Jerry to get back the map, running after him through five different levels, starting from Tom's house and continuing in the city streets, a cruise ship, a deserted island and finally a hidden labyrinth.

The game is a side-scrolling platformer. Tom's goal is to catch Jerry who always runs along at the right side of the screen. If Tom gets close he can try to grab Jerry, which ends the level, but if he misses, he loses a small amount of health. If Tom can't catch Jerry before the level end, he has to face one of Jerry's friends in a small boss fight.

Multiple dangers abound in all levels: platforms that fall away under Tom, objects falling from the ceiling and bouncing along the way. Jerry himself also has tricks up his sleeve, throwing land mines and cherry bombs at Tom. If Tom gets hurt, he can refill his health by picking up a life potion.

After successfully completing a level, one of two bonus rounds follows: Tag is a labyrinth game. Seen from the top, Tom chases Jerry through a maze. Picking up heart icons refills Tom's health and catching Jerry before the timer runs out increases Tom's life bar. Apples and Bombs has Jerry dropping either apples or bombs from a row of windows. Tom must catch the apples but avoid the bombs, which stun him temporarily. Catching 3 apples refills health whereas getting 24 or more of them increases the life bar.

sample_screenshots.caption: Got hit by a falling lamp

title: Tom and Jerry: The Movie

description:
Ernie Els Golf is a handheld golf game for up to four players. The game is similar to other golf games of its time with the golfer being viewed from a behind perspective when swinging and then switches to a top down perspective when the ball is in the air. A three click power bar is used when taking shots. On the first button press it start moving back and forth and by pressing again the amount of power is set. The third press decides the slice of the shot.

Before a shot the player can choose which club to use and change the golfer's stance as well as the position of the ball. It's also possible to see a top down view of the hole. After the shot has been taken it's possible to see replays from three different views. The game supports mulligans which means that a shot can be undone. The number of mulligans can be chosen by the player.

There are four different courses from around the world: St. Davids in Britain, Sunny Lakes in the USA, Hokkaido in Japan and Sydney in Australia. The first two have 18 holes while the later two have nine. The game features seven different game modes: practice, stroke play, match play, threesome, foursome, stableford and skins game.
title: Ernie Els Golf

description:
CJ: Elephant Fugitive is a remake of CJ's Elephant Antics, the first game in the CJ series. The game is a side scrolling platform like the original game, with largely the same features, but it contains more locations and different level design and graphics. The story is the same with CJ attempting to escape his captivity and return to Africa. Unlike the original game he starts out in London and not in Paris (which here is the second location) and on his journey he will pass through the Alps as well as Egypt before reaching his destination in the African jungles. Each location consists of a few levels and ends with a boss.

The gameplay mechanics are the same as the previous game with the player jumping between platforms while avoiding or killing the various bad guys. CJ can fire nuts through his trunk and lob bombs at enemies and when falling he can use an umbrella to land safely. The player starts out with nine lives with three hearts for each. A heart is lost when getting hit by an enemy and when all out of them a life is lost. More hearts can be picked up throughout the levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Some enemies leave fruit behind when killed
Watch out for the leaking gas pipe

title: CJ: Elephant Fugitive

description:
Magic Knight Rayearth is based on the manga series of the same name, in which three Japanese schoolgirls find themselves in the magical land of Cephiro, where, as the Magic Knights of legend, they are tasked with rescuing the princess Emauraude from the evil Zagato.

The game tells a side story set near the beginning of the girls' adventure. Their guide and companion, the rabbit-like creature Mokona, has disappeared into the Spirit Forest, and the three must venture out to find him. This quest is presented as a Japanese-style RPG, but with several unique elements.

Unlike in many games of the genre, there is no main world map filled with towns and dungeons. The game world consists of a number of small interconnected areas instead. Scattered around the world are buildings like inns where the group can rest and the game can be saved, and shops where items can be bought. Other buildings contain characters that can give hints and advice regarding the quest.

The main part of the game consists of random battles, done to level up and win gems that are used as currency. There are some similarities to the ATB system known from Final Fantasy IV and its sequels in that while actions are selected from a menu as in a standard turn-based game, the action continues during menu selection and characters need some time to recharge before they can act again. The major interface element during battles is a spinning slot-machine-like reel at the bottom of the screen that includes images of the three protagonists. The spinning speed can be lowered or raised at the push of a button. While a girl's full body is in view, she is in recharging mode. Only when the view zooms in on her portrait she can be selected for action by stopping the reel while her portrait is in the center. This then allows her to select from standard 'attack', 'magic', 'item' and 'flee' commands. Sometimes, random effects (sent by Mokona) will pop up instead of a girl being selected. These include health restoration, automatic flight, putting the enemy to sleep or even an instant kill. There are also negative effects, though, like the draining of a character's health.

sample_screenshots.caption: The bad guy and the princess
You can sleep in this house

title: Magic Knight Rayearth

description:
The Excellent Dizzy Collection compilation collects three Dizzy games previously released for the Aladdin Deck Enhancer:

  1. Dizzy the Adventurer
  2. Panic Dizzy
  3. Go! Dizzy Go!

Go! Dizzy Go! is a Adventures of Lolo arcade-style puzzle game.
title: The Excellent Dizzy Collection

description:
Like Ristar on Genesis, Ristar on Game Gear is a sidescrolling platformer about Sega's short lived stellar mascot, fighting his way through six planets to defeat the evil tyrant Greedy.

This 8-bit release of Ristar has the same plot, similar themes, and plays much like its more famous Genesis counterpart, but has a different set of levels, making it a separate game. Half of the planets are re-arrangements of the Genesis ones, and the other half are unique to this iteration. Some of Ristar's moves and various enemy mechanics have been tweaked or expanded. Also unique to Ristar on Game Gear are collectable mini-stars scattered throughout the levels, which award an extra life on collecting 100.
title: Ristar

description:
Gamma has kidnapped the hero's love and has her being held hostage at his Evil Temple hideout. The hero must defeat Gamma's forces in order to rescue his love.

Devilish is a Breakout variant. Instead of the screen remaining stationary, the game screen will scroll forward once the ball (called a power orb in this game) passes through a barrier. The game consists of eight stages. Players control a paddle and have to hit a power orb at barriers in order to break through them and the orb can also be used to destroy enemies too. The paddle itself can be configured into four different formations which are an offensive and defensive position and an L and reverse L formation.

Stages must be completed before time expires. Stages also contain treasure chests that can contain either a time bonus, a 1-Up, a Buster Ball that can break through any barrier, and a Flash Bomb which will destroy any blocks surrounding it when it explodes.

The game offers a regular game mode and a time trial mode. The time trial only includes the first six stages. Options let the player choose between an easy, normal, or hard difficulty and also let the player select the number of power orbs they have available at the start.

sample_screenshots.caption: Pause the game and see how well you are doing
In an ancient castle. Skeleton archers shoot at you as you work your way upstairs

title: Devilish

alternate_titles.description: In game title when booted in a Western Game Gear
alternate_titles.title: Ronald in the Magical World

description: When Grimace opens a box labelled "do not open", Donald McDonald and all of his friends get sucked into a magical world with no choice but to find their way out. The player takes on the role of Donald, travelling through different-themed worlds to rescue his friends and find his way back home. Donald wields a magic cane to whack enemies, and can also use an umbrella to glide through the air. Some graphics and music are shared with Treasure's better-known McDonald's Treasure Land Adventure, but the gameplay and level design in this game is completely different.
title: Donald no Magical World

description: Royal Stone: Hirakareshi Toki no Tobira is a turn-based RPG where you explore dungeons, gather information, cast magic, and recruit monsters, Royal Stone has an "elemental" system consisting of fire, wind, water, and earth to determine strengths and weaknesses. Most of the game is played out in an environment shown through a bird's-eye view, but there are also battles shown from a behind view. A party of companions can be gathered.

sample_screenshots.caption: The battle screen. The commands at the bottom are "Fight", "Block" and "Flee". Eva can't "Block", but can use "Magic" instead.
There's a simple rock-paper-scissors-element to battles, involving the respective characters elements.
You're about to get banished from the kingdom for your crimes.
Start of the first battle. Eva is flanked by her comrades Vaslery, Horai and Torris (clockwise from the upper-right).
The beginning of the game. You play as Eva, knight of the kingdom of Anzelia, and are imprisoned for treason.

title: Royal Stone: Hirakareshi Toki no Tobira

description: Hyper Pro Yakyū '92 follows the traditional rules of baseball. The player can choose to play as one of Japan's professional baseball teams. Following that, the player has the option to play in the small or big baseball field. During the gameplay, the player will play the role of the batter to try and strike the ball thrown by the pitcher. If the ball is successfully hit, the player must control the batter to do a full run around the field square.
title: Hyper Pro Yakyū '92

description: Honō no Tōkyūji: Dodge Danpei shares the characters and dodgeball concept of the Genesis game Honō no Tōkyūji: Dodge Danpei, but the gameplay is more like a dodgeball management simulator. The player has to decide which players make defense, offense and ball passes around the field, within a ten minute match.
title: Honō no Tōkyūji: Dodge Danpei

description: J.League GG Pro Striker '94 is a spin-off of the Pro Striker series. The player can choose to play as one of the twelve featured J.League football teams for the 1994 season, then challenge the others in three different modes of gameplay. Due to the smaller resolution and limitations, the football field is smaller than normal, the team members are identical-looking and the rules of the football are reduced.
title: J.League GG Pro Striker '94

description: Taisen Mahjong HaoPai is a traditional tile-based game of Mahjong that allows the player to take the role of one out of six characters. The game starts off with rolling twin dice then the player must play against the CPU or a another player and try to accumulate the minimum score needed to win.
title: Taisen Mahjong HaoPai

description: Taisen Mahjong HaoPai 2 is the sequel to Taisen Mahjong HaoPai. It retains the rules of traditional Mahjong, but has you competing against a number of CPU opponents to progress until the player can ultimately challenge the Shogun to determine the best Mahjong player.
title: Taisen Mahjong HaoPai 2

description: Based on the anime Crayon Shin-chan, Crayon Shin-chan: Taiketsu! Quantum Panic!! is made up of eleven mini-games including Worm Racing, Ball Catching, Freestyle Paddling, Balloon Pumping, Target Shooting, Beach Battle (Inspired by the Battleship board game), Maze Tagging, Number Bowling, Snowball Fighting, Music Matching and Robo Boxing. The mini-games can be played progressively in story mode or freely at the player's choice in practice mode.
title: Crayon Shin-chan: Taiketsu! Quantum Panic!!

description: Striker is a football (soccer) game with a top-down view. The player chooses one out of 64 international teams. The gameplay takes the form of a European-style knock-out cup competition. The moves include passing, penalty kicks, taking the ball, scoring and goalkeeping as per traditional soccer rules. The player has 45 minutes to score the most goals.
title: Striker

description: The game focuses on basketball played by Japanese junior teams. The game can be played with one or two players in either the Tournament or Free Play modes. The teams that can be selected are Tokyo, Okinawa, Osaka and Kanagawa, each consisting of two members. Different teams have their own skill levels of Defense, Passing and Strategy. The gameplay is done on one section of the field, where the player has to score more points than the opposing team in three minutes. In the Tournament Mode, the player must beat the three local Japanese teams then process to beat other teams worldwide.
title: Dunk Kids

description: Car Licence is a simulator teaching users how to drive. The first section includes instructions on how to drive a car. The second section shows how to identify the road traffic signs. Finally there is an endless mini-game in which the player keeps a line of cars from crossing a white line by shooting them.
title: Car Licence

description: A young adventurer arrives at a port town in pursuit of saving the lands from evil forces of Millennium. The player goes around towns, outdoor lands and dungeons throughout the adventure. Up to three members can join the adventurer's party at a time. In the typical Final Fantasy RPG style, towns have shops to purchase items and services as well as people to gather information, while the outdoor lands and dungeons have random appearing monsters which the player fights in turn-based combat. Later in the game, the player will be able to traverse across water with a ship.
title: Eternal Legend

description: Fray: Shugyouhen is a midquel to Xak. The demons of Zekisis have managed to invade the world of Xak. Fray goes on a quest to slay the demons and save the villages on the way. The player's default attack consists of single projectiles, but the player can collect power-ups for more widespread shots as well as different special elemental attacks (with mana pickups to power them). At the end of each stage, the player will have to defeat a boss, before stopping at a village, getting information and upgrades and then proceeding to the next stage.
title: Fray: Shugyō-hen

description: In Gamble Panic the player's goal is to win all the casino and parlor mini-games and try not to get broke. The mini-games consist of poker, matching pairs, slots, crane machine, blackjack, roulette, slider puzzle, baccarat, bingo, math bingo and snooker.
title: Gamble Panic

description: Zan Gear is a handheld spinoff of the Zan series. It depicts a war between Tokugawa Sekigahara (blue) and Ishida (red). The aim of the game is for the player to control the blue army and defeat the red army. Controlling army requires careful strategy by recruiting adequate soldiers and choosing where to start a battle. Capturing key fortifications will boost the blue army's control over the land. Members of the green army are neutral and can be recruited by either side.
title: Zan Gear

description: The player is charged with raising a thoroughbred horse to be the finest racing horse in the world derby. The player navigates an elaborate menu system to retrieve a horse from the stables, place bets at the betting shop, go to race track to see if the chosen horse wins and to the store to purchase equipment with available funds. With each race won, the player earns additional funs and ranks up on the race board.
title: World Derby

description: Based on the film series, the player is part of the Perfect Security Service assigned to protect his client's houses from burglaries. Before each level, the player can purchase tools with what limited money there in the bank account. In the level, the player can use both the available tools and the household traps to intimidate and harm any thieves that get inside. The player is awarded cash for every theft thwarted and penalized for every valuable stolen. The levels become progressively harder with additional and smarter thieves in the gang and more valuables to guard.
title: Torarete Tamaruka!?

description: There are different gameplay modes. The Open Mode allows the player will face five different baseball teams from either the Central or Pacific region, then having to beat the other five. The Versus Mode has the player playing against the CPU or another player. The Tournament Mode has the beat all teams from the Central and Pacific regions. Before starting the game, the player has to pick a team to play as, then manage the team by choosing who gets to be batter and pitcher, followed by a choice of stadium to play in. The game has the player either batting or pitching the ball, with the traditional rules of baseball incorporated.
title: Tatakae! Pro Yakyū Twin League

description: The player goes to a psychic, a medium or a fortuneteller to have a future told. The game makes use of Tarot cards based on the Major Arcana group. Three of the cards are chosen by the player and the remaining seven are randomly determined by the CPU. The meaning behind the cards are shown and the player leaves the House of Tarot, before the game starts again for the player to try again for a different future.
title: House of Tarot

description: Sports Trivia combines football management with a sports quiz. In order for the player to win a football match, a careful strategy must be chosen, then the player must answer some sport-related questions in a limited. More correct answers will allow the player's team more yardage across the field for a higher chance of scoring.
title: Sports Trivia

description: The player travels to the Quizgear World to challenge opponents (CPU or human player) to a quiz made up of questions with multiple choice answers. The player must select the correct answers in a limited time to try and gain more points than the opponent. Some questions are text-based, others consist of picture cards. Some rounds are mini-games which are either skill or luck-based.
title: The Quiz Gear Fight!!

description: Based on Takehiko Inoue's manga and anime, Slam Dunk: Shouri e no Starting 5 has both a story mode and a CPU match mode The player can pick one of four teams for the Slam Dunk tournament. Before starting the game, the player decides what roles the six team members will be and their exact positions in the basketball court. The gameplay shows the players from an overhead perspective, highlighting who is dribbling the ball and the opponent in pursuit. Close ups show major movements such as starting the match, defending a basketball hoop and scoring a goal.
title: Slam Dunk: Shōri e no Starting 5

description: This game features the characters of the Popeye cartoon. The player has Popeye or Olive Oyl playing volleyball against Bluto in six different locations. During the game, the player can find a hidden can of spinach to allow Popeye or Olive's to perform strong tackles. Winning a volleyball match, grants the player the opportunity to play one of six bonus mini-games only once, in which winning will grant extra continues. In each location to follow, the player is able to choose characters to be a volleyball partner including J. Wellington Wimpy, Dufus, Poopdeck Pappy, Sea Hag, Eugene the Jeep and Swee'Pea. Winning the game gives the player the chance to play on a higher difficulty.
title: Popeye Beach Volleyball

description: The game is a pet care simulator, in which the raises one of five different breeds of puppy dogs. The puppy must be trained in different areas of a virtual domestic environment, including the household, the park and other locations. The player will need to ensure the puppy gets adequate exercise, food, cleanliness and playtime to progress further into the game.
title: Pet Club: Inu Daisuki!

description: The player travels around Japan to challenge opponents to game of Mahjong. The game applies the traditional Riichi Mahjong rules with tiles and a pair of six-sided die. The player must beat with highest possible score in order to win their betting money.
title: Pocket Jansō

description: In this baseball game, the player has four different modes to choose from including two levels of Standard mode, the All-Star game mode which puts two of the best teams against one another and the Home Run Contest mode. The player has the option to pick one of six teams in either the C-League or the P-League, then decides which team members bat and pitch. The player must win nine rounds in the game to beat the opposing team.
title: The Pro Yakyū '91

description: Playing the traditional rules of baseball, this game features an Open Mode for solo play, a Versus Mode to play a single match against the CPU or second player and a Pennant Race, which consists of national teams at the time of development. The player can also view the Players Data and custom edit the teams. The game takes place in one of three stadium types of the player's choice. During game play, the player takes the role of a batter to hit the ball and do a home run.
title: Pro Yakyū GG League

description: The game is a sequel to Pro Yakyuu GG League, sharing many of the features and graphics. Now the number of game modes are narrowed down to an Open Mode, Versus Mode and Tournament Mode and no team editing, just Players Data. There are also new teams for its time, voice samples, auto play, different view perspectives and four different stadiums to play in.
title: Pro Yakyū GG League '94

description: Based on the anime of the same name, the game has the young ninja Fūsuke and his trusty penguin fighting the evil Empire and reuniting the Ninku corps to ultimately defeat the turncoat Kisumi. Much of the game makes use of static cutscenes and dialogue. Combat takes the form of action fighting, requiring the player to beat opponents one after the other. As the game progresses, the player will have additional characters to join Fūsuke's party, some of which can be selected to fight in Fūsuke's place, having their own unique moves.
title: Ninku

description: This game serves as a sequel to Ninku with Fūsuke and his party going on another journey to fight and defeat Kisumi once again. There are three modes including the Story Mode, a Battle Mode and a Player versus Player Mode. The story is now told in snapshots with character avatars. Combat encounters work a lot like the prequel with characters have their own moves, but the player fights single tough opponents instead of multiple weak opponents.
title: Ninku 2: Tenkūryū e no Michi

description: In this spin-off title of the Ninku series, the player controls Fūsuke's penguin Hiroyuki in a series of puzzle rooms, pushing blocks to crush spawning enemies or break them in the style of Pengo. The player can place three gemstone block together in a row for a lot of bonus points.
title: Ninku Gaiden: Hiroyuki Daikatsugeki

description: Based on the 1964 Japanese puppet show of the same name, the game has the playing moving the titular island across the ocean to the finishing point, while rescuing stranded people, dodging hazards and pursuing enemies, collecting currency gems and purchasing items in shops with those gems.
title: Hyokkori Hyōtanjima: Hyōtanjima no Daikōkai

description: In the world of Moldorian two races humans and magi live in peace, until this peace is fractured by the recent appearance of monsters across the lands. A youth named Navarre and his companion Miria go on a small adventure but when Miria is kidnapped, Navarre gradually finds himself in the thick of the conflict. Many of the game's mechanics both in town, outdoors and combat work like Final Fantasy. The most significant feature in the combat system is pressing a button and direction together to perform an action. The player can have a maximum of two companions to go with Navarre. As the game progresses, the player will be joined by a different character at a certain point.
title: Moldorian: Hikari to Yami no Shimai

description: The game continues where it left off from Magic Knight Rayearth with the schoolgirl trio. The main gameplay consists of slice-of-life simulation in Cephiro, but the player has a minimal amount of control after selecting an activity. The game also contains a hidden mini game.
title: Magic Knight Rayearth 2: Making of Magic Knight

description: Based on the anime series of the same name, juvenile samurai Yaiba Kurogane goes on an adventure across Japan while trying to learn the secrets of his sword. The game is made up of mainly platforming levels, with a few instances of runner levels and story-based cutscenes between every part that makes up the level.
title: Kenyū Densetsu Yaiba

description: This title is a spiritual sequel to J.League GG Pro Striker '94. The player can choose to play as one of the fourteen featured J.League football teams for the 1995 season and then select one of four different gameplay modes. It is also possible to custom edit the teams. The football field is displayed in a bird's eye perspective and the rules of traditional football are better incorporated.
title: J.League Soccer Dream Eleven

description: Gear Stadium Heiseiban is essentially an updated version of Batter Up, featuring the traditions of Nippon Professional Baseball with real Japanese teams from the 1995 season and two different kinds of stadiums.
title: Gear Stadium Heiseiban

description:
Adapted from the animated TV series of the same name, the Phantom goes up against the Biot threat, which are a part of Maximum Inc.’s private army. Meanwhile the giant corporation is developing a new kind of Biot to take down the Phantom.

The player navigates the Phantom through seven levels, completing some mission objectives to progress. The player can acquire and utilize weapons with limited ammo, and gadgets such as invisibility. The game consists of mainly platformer levels, but does incorporate a couple of vertical scrolling shooter levels. In some parts of a platformer level, the player must hack a computer in the form of a mini-game to bypass a locked door.

sample_screenshots.caption: Don't come closer to the gator.

title: Phantom 2040

description: This platforming game stars the titular robotic cat Doraemon from the anime of the same name. The player must traverse through the levels collecting cheeseburgers (all of them for a perfect score) and cat bells, while facing robotic enemies. Doraemon's methods of attacking are either jumping on enemies or shooting them with a projectile powerup. After every three levels, the player will need to defeat a boss enemy to proceed to the next stage.
title: Doraemon: Nora no Suke no Yabō

description: The titular anime character Doraemon and his friend Nobita Nobi are featured in this interactive story-based party game embarking a on journey, in which the player picks a route across a number of circles on an overworld map. On each the circle, a minigame must be won to progress to the next circle
title: Doraemon: Wakuwaku Pocket Paradise

description: F1 World Championship Edition features real Formula racing drivers, in which the player can pick one to compete in races including Damon Hill, David Coulthard, Michael Schumacher, Jyrki Juhani Järvilehto, Johnny Herbert, Pedro Lamy, Jean Alesi, Mika Häkkinen, Gerhard Berger, Mark Blundell, Martin Brundle and Ukyo Katayama. The game offers a Practice Mode, an Arcade Mode and a Championship Mode with three different difficulty settings and options to choose the number of racing laps. There are eight different circuit race tracks.
title: F1: World Championship Edition

description: It is the year 2015 and the terrorist organization NAC are quickly taking over the known world. From the ranks of the NAC, the player takes the role of a renegade fighter pilot from the Freedom unit to strike and destroy the NAC threat. Sharing similar mechanics to the Sega Master System game, the player flies through a number of stages shooting air, ground and naval enemies as well as collecting powerups. Each mission consists of two or three stages, ending with a boss.

sample_screenshots.caption: Get the item to gain extra speed

title: Aerial Assault

description:
In his weakness of arrogance, the mighty warrior and alchemist Chakan challenged Death. Although his fight ends in victory, it comes at a terrible price that cripples his body, and torments his mind. Now Chakan seeks to slay all Death's servants to free himself from the damage he suffered.

The player controls Chakan to traverse through multiple platform levels divided among six elemental planes, using dual swords to fight enemies, and double jumps for a height boost. The player can acquire four different kinds of potions and mix them into particular concoctions to perform some alchemical spell, as well as obtain different weapons with their own elemental attacks.

sample_screenshots.caption: We've failed and become death's servant
Some phoenix-like things arise from the lava

title: Chakan
